intro: Christianella paludicola, commonly known as the bog orchid, is a rare and specialized plant found in wetland habitats. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, often pink or purple-colored flowers. The plant typically grows in acidic, nutrient-poor soils and requires a humid environment to thrive. Its root system is adapted to absorb nutrients from the waterlogged substrate. Due to its specific ecological requirements, it is considered a sensitive indicator of wetland health.
